intro: Pedicularis bicuspidata, commonly known as the two-lobed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from red to orange, often resembling those of orchids. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
